Class.name: EasyCSP.Validator.Validators.isMD5Hash
Class.Description: Tests a string to see if it meets the criteria of looking like an MD5 hash string (32 hexadecimal characters)

Method.name: run
Method.Implementation:
attribute = @ME->init(parameters) if attribute->hasErrors() then return attribute
value = attribute->value
if $get(value) = "" then return attribute ; * use "Required" to determind data presence if len(value) <> 32 then attribute->setError("An MD5 hash consists of 32 hexadecimal characters.") return attribute ; * an MD5 hash is thirty-two characters long end
* Strip out all the legal hexadecimal characters. If anything is left then the string wasn't an MD5 hash. testValue = convert("abcdef1234567890", "", downcase(value)) if len(testValue) > 0 then attribute->setError("An MD5 has consists of only hexadecimal characters (0..9, a..f)") return attribute ; * this is not a hash as it contains other than hex characters end
return attribute ; * it's 32 characters long and contains only hex digits
